publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3031 Linda Fabiani: Reduction in Wheelchair Accessible Seats in New Parliament Chamber-That the Parliament regrets that the Scottish Parliamentary Corporate Body, whilst noting the dissent of the Holyrood Progress Group, has instructed that the Chamber design in the new Parliament building be altered from that circulated to all members and agreed in September 1999, with the result that the choice of accessible Chamber seats for any member using a standard wheelchair is reduced from 81 to 61. Supported by: Mr John Home Robertson*

S1M-3031 Reduction in Wheelchair Accessible Seats in New Parliament Chamber (lodged on 24 April 2002) Irene McGugan*, Fiona McLeod*, Andrew Wilson*, Christine Grahame*, Dr Winnie Ewing*, Colin Campbell*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Michael Russell*, Tricia Marwick*, Stewart Stevenson*, Kate Maclean*, Richard Lochhead*, Trish Godman*, Karen Whitefield*, Rhona Brankin*, Mr Michael McMahon*, Angus MacKay*, Jackie Baillie*, Bill Butler*, Mr John McAllion*, Des McNulty*
